name: Aldinger, William F
title: Chairman and CEO
notes: William F. Aldinger III (born 1947) served as President, Chairman, and CEO of Household International from 1994 to 2005. Following HSBC's acquisition of Household in 2003, he became Chairman and CEO of HSBC North America. He was a defendant in a landmark $2.46 billion securities fraud judgment (2013) related to misleading disclosures in Household's 2001 Form 10-K.
political_donations: No specific FEC donation records found via OpenSecrets search.

name: Berggruen, John
title: Owner / Art Dealer
notes: John Henry Berggruen (born June 18, 1943) is a San Francisco art dealer who has owned and operated Berggruen Gallery since 1970. Son of German-born art dealer Heinz Berggruen and Lillian Zellerbach, he has represented major artists including Wayne Thiebaud, Richard Diebenkorn, and Ed Ruscha. The gallery is a fixture of the Bay Area art scene, currently located in the South of Market district.
ngos: Art Dealers Association of America (ADAA) member gallery
political_donations: John Berggruen Gallery reported $30,975 in political contributions in the 2024 cycle per OpenSecrets.

name: McCune, Brian Adam
title: Talent Development Producer / Composer
notes: Brian Adam McCune holds an M.M. in Music Composition from New School University and a B.M. in Music Performance from UNC Chapel Hill. He worked as Manager of Musical Content and Lead Notetracker for Ubisoft's Rocksmith franchise and is currently Talent Development Producer at Red Storm Entertainment. He previously served as Associate Artistic Director of the Awesome Orchestra Collective, a non-profit orchestra.
ngos: Former Associate Artistic Director, Awesome Orchestra Collective (non-profit)

name: Moore, James A. III
employer: InterMountain Management / Moore Family Interests LLC
title: Partner / Managing Partner
notes: James Moore III has served as Partner at InterMountain Hotels and as Managing Partner at Moore Family Interests, LLC since 2013. He was previously Regional Director of Operations at InterMountain Management from 2010 to 2013. He studied Business Management at Louisiana Tech University.

name: Moore, Scot Elison
title: Assistant Principal Violist
notes: Scot Moore is the Assistant Principal Violist with the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra. He holds a BA, BM, MA, and Performance Certificate from Bard College, and maintains an active performance schedule with SF Opera, Monterey Symphony, Symphony San Jose, and Santa Cruz Symphony. He is also an experienced performer in folk, rock, jazz, and contemporary improvisation.

name: Moore, Stephen A.
title: Senior Vice President, Chief Legal Officer, and Corporate Secretary
notes: Stephen A. Moore joined Personalis (NASDAQ: PSNL), an advanced genomics company, as General Counsel in 2020 and was promoted to SVP & CLO in 2024. He has over twenty years of in-house legal experience at genomics companies including Pacific Biosciences, Navigenics, and Affymetrix. He holds a B.A. from San Jose State University and a J.D. from UC Davis.
political_donations: Filed Form 4 SEC disclosures as CLO/Corporate Secretary of Personalis (PSNL); stock transactions on record.

name: Moores, William York
title: Physician (Thoracic Surgery / General Surgery)
notes: Dr. William York Moores is a physician in San Francisco, CA who graduated from Yale University School of Medicine in 1966. His specialties include Thoracic Surgery and Public Health & General Preventive Medicine. He completed residency in Surgery and a Fellowship in Thoracic Surgery at the University of Michigan.

name: Neale, Alasdair
employer: Sun Valley Music Festival / New Haven Symphony Orchestra (former)
title: Music Director
notes: Alasdair Neale is a British-American conductor who served as Music Director of the Marin Symphony for 22 years (2001-2023) and as Associate Conductor of the San Francisco Symphony for 12 years. He has been Music Director of the Sun Valley Music Festival for over 30 years, and completed a 5-year tenure as Music Director of the New Haven Symphony Orchestra in 2024. He holds degrees from Cambridge University and Yale University.
ngos: Music Director, Sun Valley Music Festival (largest privately funded free-admission symphony in America)

name: Olenick, Paul
title: Product Management Leader
notes: Paul Olenick is a product management leader with over 15 years of experience across multiple industries, currently with Atlassian, based in Austin, TX. He has also held roles at AvePoint as Director of Product Strategy. The specific 'Paul Olenick' from the Uplifters camp could not be definitively confirmed as this individual.

name: Olivier, Rufus
employer: San Francisco Opera / San Francisco Ballet / Stanford University
title: Principal Bassoonist / Lecturer
notes: Rufus Olivier is the Principal Bassoonist with both the San Francisco Opera and the San Francisco Ballet Orchestra. He joined the San Francisco Symphony at age 21 in 1977 and became principal at SF Opera at age 24 in 1980, the youngest ever. He teaches at Stanford University and Mills College, is a founding member of the Stanford Wind Quintet, and won a Grammy for the Sesame Street film 'Elmo in Grouchland.' In 1993, San Francisco Mayor Frank Jordan awarded him the Seal of the City in recognition of his contributions.
ngos: Founding member, Anchor Chamber Players; founding member, Midsummer Mozart Orchestra

name: Potochny, James
employer: Leaf Clean Energy Company / BGS Consulting (interim CFO)
title: CEO / CFO
notes: James (Jim) Potochny was appointed CFO of Leaf Clean Energy Company in 2010 and added to its board as CEO in 2014. He has a 25-year career spanning corporate development, finance, and accounting, holding prior CFO roles at MicroEdge, Arkivio, and CDS. Earlier career roles include positions in corporate development at Hewlett-Packard and manufacturing engineering at Intel. He holds an MBA from Stanford University and a BS in Electrical Engineering from Yale University.
ngos: Board of Directors, Leaf Clean Energy Company

name: Prater, Doy
title: Music Teacher
notes: Doy Prater was a longtime music teacher in the Burlingame, California school district. Salary records show he was employed as Teacher-Music at Burlingame Elementary. His wife, Carol Prater, was also a music teacher in the same district for approximately 50 years. Both were long-time members of the Burlingame music education community.

name: Pyszkowski, Jason
employer: San Francisco Symphony / Always Fishing Hospitality Group
title: Associate Director, Youth Orchestra Program / Hospitality
notes: Jason Pyszkowski is a freelance violist, musical administrator, and graduate of the San Francisco Conservatory of Music (class of 2010). He has served as Associate Director of the Youth Orchestra Program at the San Francisco Symphony and works with Always Fishing Hospitality Group. He is a member of the SFCM Alumni Council and serves as an advisor to the Vicente Chamber Orchestra.
ngos: Advisor, Vicente Chamber Orchestra; SFCM Alumni Council member

name: Reinhart, Floyd
title: Director, Information Technology
notes: Floyd Reinhart is the Director of Information Technology at AccountMate Software Corporation, based in Petaluma, California. He attended Berklee College of Music from 1978 to 1980. He previously served as a board member of the Sonoma County Philharmonic (also known as the American Philharmonic Sonoma County).
ngos: Former Board Member, Sonoma County Philharmonic (American Philharmonic)

name: Santana, Irving G.
employer: San Francisco State University / Ruth Asawa SF School of the Arts
title: Lecturer / Artist in Residence
notes: Irving Santana is a violist and music educator serving as Lecturer Faculty in the viola department at San Francisco State University and as Artist in Residence at Ruth Asawa SF School of the Arts. He is an active freelance performer in the Bay Area, frequently playing assistant principal and principal viola chairs with various ensembles. He also teaches at the Golden State Youth Orchestra.
ngos: Artist in Residence, Ruth Asawa SF School of the Arts

name: Sehgal, Ravinder
title: Professor of Biology
notes: Dr. Ravinder Sehgal is a Full Professor in the Department of Biology at San Francisco State University, where he teaches parasitology and emerging infectious diseases. His research focuses on the ecology of avian diseases, including how deforestation impacts avian malaria in African rainforest birds. He holds a Ph.D. in Cell Biology from UCSF and is also an accomplished musician (bassoon and piano).
ngos: Board of Directors, San Francisco Vegan Society; San Francisco Vegetarian Society (20+ year member)

name: Sharp, Neil
title: Practitioner and Research Coordinator
notes: Neil Sharp, M.D., trained as a physician in the U.K. before pursuing a career in music as an opera singer, then transitioned to NeuroMovement practice. He has been associated with the Anat Baniel Method since 2004 and relocated to San Rafael, California in 2007 to serve as a practitioner and Research Coordinator at the ABM Center. He also teaches as a faculty member at Esalen Institute.

name: Smiell, Joseph E.
title: Principal and Chief Financial Officer
notes: Joseph E. Smiell serves as Principal and CFO at Questa Engineering Corporation, an award-winning civil, geotechnical, and water resources engineering and landscape architecture firm based in Richmond, California. The firm specializes in planning, design, and environmental services in the San Francisco Bay Area.

name: Song, Andrew

Richard Stevens was a noted computer science author (deceased 1999). The specific Uplifters member could not be identified.

name: Stewart, Daniel Patrick
employer: Santa Cruz Symphony / San Francisco Symphony Youth Orchestra
title: Music Director
notes: Daniel Stewart is Music Director of the Santa Cruz Symphony (since 2013, contract extended through 2031) and was Wattis Foundation Music Director of the San Francisco Symphony Youth Orchestra from 2019 to 2024. A San Francisco native and graduate of the Curtis Institute of Music, he trained with Otto-Werner Mueller and studied with Michael Tilson Thomas and Simon Rattle. He is also a violist, composer, and won the Aspen Music Festival's James Conlon Conducting Prize in 2010.
ngos: Music Director, Santa Cruz Symphony (501c3 nonprofit)

name: Summa, Terry L.
title: Director of Bands, Emeritus
notes: Terry L. Summa served as Director of Bands at Foothill College in Los Altos Hills, California for over twenty years before retiring. Prior to Foothill College, he taught at San Rafael High School (eight years) and Oceana High School (two years). He was inducted into the California Alliance for Jazz Hall of Fame for his sustained contributions as a jazz educator.
ngos: California Alliance for Jazz Hall of Fame inductee

name: Teich, Steve Emery
employer: Law Office of Steve Emery Teich
title: Attorney at Law
notes: Steve Emery Teich is a California criminal defense and business litigation attorney who has practiced law for over 43 years in both federal and state courts in Northern California. He was admitted to the California Bar on December 21, 1977, and graduated from UC Hastings College of Law. His office is based in Pacifica and San Francisco, California.

name: Todd, Robert B.
employer: OLLI at UC Berkeley / EdTech consulting
title: Faculty Lecturer / Tech Executive
notes: Robert Todd is a Faculty Lecturer at OLLI (Osher Lifelong Learning Institute) at UC Berkeley, where he teaches courses on artificial intelligence and its social impact. He built his career at McKinsey & Co, LinkedIn, and San Francisco State University, and served as Chief Innovation Officer and Chief Product Officer at Emtrain. He now advises AI-powered edtech startups while teaching. This profile cannot be definitively confirmed as the specific 'Robert B. Todd' from the Uplifters camp.

name: Tuan, Bertrand
employer: Pacific Hematology-Oncology Associates / Sutter Health (California Pacific Medical Center)
title: Physician - Hematologist/Oncologist
notes: Dr. Bertrand Y. Tuan, MD is a hematologist-oncologist with over 40 years of experience in San Francisco, California. He received his MD from Albert Einstein College of Medicine, completed residency in internal medicine at Boston City Hospital, and a fellowship in hematology-oncology at Massachusetts General Hospital. He is affiliated with California Pacific Medical Center and Novato Community Hospital, and participates in clinical trials.

name: Vaughan, Richard Haylest
title: Music Director / Cellist
notes: Richard Vaughan served as music director and teacher at Hillview Middle School in Menlo Park, California for 23 years (2001-2024), retiring in spring 2024. A National Board certified music educator and cellist, he performed internationally in chamber music festivals and as a soloist. He grew up in Portola Valley and attended Menlo School. Prior to Hillview, he served as music director at Woodside School and as Assistant Conductor with the El Camino Youth Symphony (1997-2001).

name: Walters, Frank L. Jr.
title: Managing Director, Capital Markets
notes: Frank Walters joined Silver Lake in 2013 and serves as Managing Director on the Capital Markets team, based in San Francisco. Previously he was a Senior Operations Analyst at Workday, an Associate at Kelso & Company (private equity), and an Investment Banking Analyst at Lehman Brothers in the Financial Sponsors Group. He holds an M.B.A. from Columbia Business School and a B.A. from Princeton University.
